definition: tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Waiting time does not have to be wasted time.
sentences.chinese: 等候的时间未必就要干瞪眼。

sentences.english: Annoyed commuters could only watch as the departure time ticked by.
sentences.chinese: 随着发车时间一点点过去，恼怒的上班族只能干瞪眼。

sentences.english: Having stuffed himself with blackberries, Timmy could only sit staring at the dinner table.
sentences.chinese: 蒂米塞了一肚子的黑莓，在饭桌上只好干瞪眼了。

sentences.english: They couldn't do anything but stand there and stare.
sentences.chinese: 除了站那里干瞪眼外，他们什么也做不了。

sentences.english: Timmy could only sit staring at the dinner table.
sentences.chinese: 在饭桌上只好干瞪眼了。

sentences.english: So we could do nothing but look on.

definition: to stare blankly/to look on helplessly/to look on unfeelingly
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
lit. to gaze at the ocean and lament one's inadequacy (idiom)/fig. to feel powerless and incompetent (to perform a task)
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
to tweak one's ears and scratch one's cheeks (as an expression of anxiety, delight, frustration etc) (idiom)
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
